title: Dana Kerem
text:
Dana Kerem (born 11 September 1986) is an Israeli <a href="women%27s%20soccer">football</a> <a href="defender%20%28soccer%29">defender</a> currently playing in the <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">Ligat Nashim Rishona</a> for <a href="ASA%20Tel%20Aviv%20University">ASA Tel Aviv University</a>, with which she had also played in the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">Champions League</a>. She was a member of the <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Israeli national team</a> during the <a href="2007%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28UEFA%29">2007 World Cup qualifying</a>. She made her debut on 21 August 2005 against <a href="Estonia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Estonia</a>.
Club career.
Kerem started her career at the age of 14, joining <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a>. In 2002, after Maccabi Tel Aviv had folded, Kerem joined <a href="ASA%20Tel%20Aviv%20University">ASA Tel Aviv University</a>, where she played until 2006.
In summer 2006, Kerem joined <a href="Temple%20Owls">Temple Owls</a>, where she played for one season, before returning to <a href="ASA%20Tel%20Aviv%20University">ASA Tel Aviv University</a>.
In her second tenure at ASA Tel Aviv, Kerem won with the club five <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">championships</a> and three <a href="Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">cups</a>, and represented the club in <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">UEFA Women's Champions League</a>, playing a total of 17 matches for the team between 2010 and 2014.
International career.
Kerem made her debut in the <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Israel women's national football team</a> in 2005 against <a href="Estonia%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Estonia</a> and played two other matches in the <a href="2007%20FIFA%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28UEFA%29">2007 World Cup qualification</a>. On 19 June 2014, after 8 years of absence, Kerem made a return to the national team, in a match against <a href="Denmark%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Denmark</a>.
Kerem also played for <a href="Israel%20women%27s%20national%20under-19%20football%20team">the U-19 national team</a>, making 12 appearances between 2002 and 2005.
